Submodules¶

Quanta.Element module¶

Element represents a individual block. It can hold a widget and handle operations with it. While setting and removing, a child_dict named dictionary is taken and returned.

class Quanta.Element.Element(child_dict=None, use_action_button=True, pack_type=<enum GTK_PACK_START of type Gtk.PackType>, **kwargs)¶

Bases: gi.repository.Gtk.Bin

ACTION_LMB = 1¶
ACTION_MMB = 2¶
ACTION_RMB = 3¶
INVALID_REMOVE = 'Quanta Element has no child'¶
clear_child()¶

Clears the child at self. After clearing, child-cleared signal is emitted.

get_child()¶

Gets the child held by self.

Returns

The child of self`or None if `self has no child.

Return type

Gtk.Widget

get_child_name()¶

Gets the name of child held by self.

Returns

The child name of self or None if self has no child.

Return type

str

get_header_child()¶

Gets the child packed at the header of self.

Returns

The header child of self or None if self has no header child.

Return type

Gtk.Widget

get_icon()¶

Gets the icon representing child held by self.

Returns

The icon of action_button or None if self has no icon for child..

Return type

Gtk.Image

get_props()¶

Gets the properties of child held by self.

Returns

The dictionary that can be later used to build the same interface.

Return type

dict

get_provider()¶

Gets the provider for child held by self.

Returns

The provider of self or None if self has no child.

Return type

Quanta.Provider

remove_child()¶

Removes the child held by self.

Raises

ValueError – Raised when self has no child.

Returns

A dictionary with child properties.

Return type

dict

Note

By removing a child, all its associated properties like icon, header child are also removed. A child-removed signal is emitted by self after removal.

set_child(child_dict)¶

Sets the child in self from given properties.

Parameters

child_dict (dict) – A valid dictionary with properties of child.

Note

If self already has a child, then its cleared before adding this new child. A child-added signal is emitted after addition.

set_child_name(child_name)¶

Sets the name of child held by self.

Parameters

child_name (str) – The new name of child.

set_from_props(props)¶

Sets the interface of self from given properties.

Parameters

props (dict) – The dictionary from which properties are set.

Note

If self already has a child, then its cleared before adding this new child.

set_header_child(header_child)¶

Sets the header child of self.

Parameters

header_child (Gtk.Widget) – The new header child of self.

Note

Using this method when self already has a header child leads to unexpected results.

set_icon(icon)¶

Sets the icon of child held by self.

Parameters

icon (Gtk.Image) – The new icon of child.

set_provider(provider)¶

Sets the provider of child held by self.

Parameters

provider (Quanta.Provider) – The new provider of child.

Quanta.Providers module¶

Quanta.Provider acts as a producer of widgets that are placed as child in Quanta.Element.

class Quanta.Providers.Provider(name)¶

Bases: gi.overrides.GObject.Object

Parameters

child_dict (dict) – A dictionary with properties of the child.

Parameters

  • child (Gtk.Widget) – The child produced by self.

  • header_child (Gtk.Widget) – The header child produced by self.

Returns

A dictionary with interface properties of child.

Return type

dict

Module contents¶

Quanta lets you create dynamical graphical user interfaces that is easier for a developer to implement, plugin to join and user to tweak.

Quanta.add_to_notebook(element, notebook, position=-1)¶

Adds an element to notebook.

Parameters

  • element (Quanta.Element) – The element to be added to notebook.

  • notebook (Quanta.Notebook) – The notebook to which the element has to be added

  • position (int) – The position at which the element has to be inserted. When not provided, it takes up value of -1, which inserts the element as last page.

Raises

TypeError – When given element is not of type Quanta.Element.

Note

When the given element is already a child of some container, the function removes it from the parent and adds the notebook to parent. Then the orphan element is added to notebook at the given position.

Quanta.add_to_paned(child1, child2, paned, position)¶

Adds the given children to paned determined by position.

Parameters

  • child1 (Gtk.Widget) – The main child which is added at given position.

  • child2 (Gtk.Widget) – The other child which is added at the complement of given position. It has to be an orphan.

  • paned (Quanta.Paned) – The paned to which the children has to be added.

  • position (int) – An integer value that is either 1 or 2. The complement of 1 is 2 and vice-versa.

Note

The main child child1 is added at first panel if position is 1 or second panel if position is 2. With respect to position of child1, child2 is added at the complement panel. When position is neither 1 nor 2, nothing is done. If child1 is already a child of parent, it is removed from the parent and paned is added back in its position. Then, the orphans child1 and child2 are added at requred places.

Quanta.add_to_view(child, view)¶

Adds the given child to given view.

Parameters

  • child (Gtk.Widget or Quanta.Element) – The child that has to be added to the view. It has to be an orphan.

  • view (Any valid Quanta.View heir) – The view to which the child has to be added.

Note

If the child is not an orphan, it is removed from its parent and the view is added back in its place. Then the child is added to the view.

Warning

This function is given as a fall-back case and should never be used blindly without knowing the properties of child and view. When the view already has a child or requires more information about adding it, exceptions are raised. Still, the view may try its best to add the child at the possible place, only when it can.

Incase of view being a Quanta.Notebook, it appends the child to the last position. But it requires child to be a Quanta.Element. So at either case, you still have limitations that may end up in a weird result. For the same reasons, child has to be an orphan.

Quanta.change_child_at_element(element, provider, child_name)¶

Changes the child at given element with a child of given name provided by provider.

Parameters

  • element (Quanta.Element) – The element whose child has to be changed.

  • provider (Quanta.Provider) – The provider that acts as source of child.

  • child_name (str) – The name of child that acts as its identification.

Note

The previous child at the element is cleared, after which the new child is added.

Quanta.get_interface(top_level)¶

Gets the interface starting from the given top level.

Parameters

top_level (Quanta.View heir) – A valid heir of Quanta.View which acts as the root widget.

Returns

A dictionary with properties to build interface.

Return type

dict

Quanta.remove_element(element, view)¶

Removes element from view.

Parameters

  • element (Quanta.Element) – The element to be removed.

  • view (Quanta.View heir) – The view from which element has to be removed.

Note

As per conventions, the behaviour of this function may seem absolutely absurd. When view is a Quanta.Bin, it clears element. For other types of views, it removes element. Then, if the number of children in view is one, it replaces view with the other child of view.

Quanta.replace_child(view, child1, child2)¶

Replaces a child of of a view with another child.

Parameters

  • view (Quanta.View heir) – The view whose child has to be replaced.

  • child1 (Gtk.Widget) – The child of given view which has to be replaced.

  • child2 (Gtk.Widget) – The child which replaces the present child in view.

Raises

TypeError – Raised when the given view is not a heir of Quanta.View.

Quanta.set_interface(interface_dict, top_level, creator_maps, init_maps)¶

Sets the interface at the top level.

Parameters

  • interface_dict (dict) – A dictionary that can be used to set interface.

  • top_level (Quanta.View heir or Quanta.Element) – The root widget from which the interface has to be set.

  • creator_maps (dict) – A dictionary of format {key: (func, args, kwargs)}, that is used to create the required object. The object is then created using the func(*args, **kwargs) and is substitued as value in interface_dict which has key key.

  • init_maps (dict) – A dictionary of format {key: object} already initialised objects. The occurences of key in inerface_dict is then replaced with object.

Returns

The widget that was previous child of top_level, None if top_level has no child.

Return type

Gtk.Widget
